trans-unit.source: How to configure Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: How to configure Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Understand the default Redis configuration for Azure Redis Cache and learn how to configure your Azure Redis Cache instances
trans-unit.target: Understand the default Redis configuration for Azure Redis Cache and learn how to configure your Azure Redis Cache instances

trans-unit.source: How to configure Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: How to configure Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to review and update the configuration for your Azure Redis Cache instances, and covers the default Redis server configuration for Azure Redis Cache instances.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to review and update the configuration for your Azure Redis Cache instances, and covers the default Redis server configuration for Azure Redis Cache instances.

trans-unit.source: Configure Redis cache settings
trans-unit.target: Configure Redis cache settings

trans-unit.source: Caches can be accessed in the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) using the **Browse** blade.
trans-unit.target: Caches can be accessed in the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) using the **Browse** blade.

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache Browse Blade
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache Browse Blade

trans-unit.source: Click **Redis Caches** to view your caches.
trans-unit.target: Click **Redis Caches** to view your caches.

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache Browse Cache List
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache Browse Cache List

trans-unit.source: Select the desired cache to view the properties for that cache.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired cache to view the properties for that cache.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache All Settings
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache All Settings

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** or **All settings** to view and configure your cache.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** or **All settings** to view and configure your cache.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Settings
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Settings

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Click **Properties** to view information about your cache, including the cache endpoint and ports.
trans-unit.target: Click **Properties** to view information about your cache, including the cache endpoint and ports.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Properties
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Properties

trans-unit.source: Access keys
trans-unit.target: Access keys

trans-unit.source: Click **Access keys** to view or regenerate the access keys for your cache.
trans-unit.target: Click **Access keys** to view or regenerate the access keys for your cache.

trans-unit.source: These keys are used along with the host name and ports from the **Properties** blade by the clients connecting to your cache.
trans-unit.target: These keys are used along with the host name and ports from the **Properties** blade by the clients connecting to your cache.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Access Keys
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Access Keys

trans-unit.source: Access Ports
trans-unit.target: Access Ports

trans-unit.source: By default, non-SSL access is disabled for new caches.
trans-unit.target: By default, non-SSL access is disabled for new caches.

trans-unit.source: To enable the non-SSL port, click **Access Ports** blade and then click **No**.
trans-unit.target: To enable the non-SSL port, click **Access Ports** blade and then click **No**.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Access Ports
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Access Ports

trans-unit.source: Pricing tier
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier

trans-unit.source: Click **Pricing tier** to view or change the pricing tier for your cache.
trans-unit.target: Click **Pricing tier** to view or change the pricing tier for your cache.

trans-unit.source: For more information on scaling, see [How to Scale Azure Redis Cache](cache-how-to-scale.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on scaling, see [How to Scale Azure Redis Cache](cache-how-to-scale.md).

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache pricing tier
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache pricing tier

trans-unit.source: Diagnostics
trans-unit.target: Diagnostics

trans-unit.source: Click **Diagnostics** to configure the storage account used to store cache diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: Click **Diagnostics** to configure the storage account used to store cache diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Diagnostics
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Diagnostics

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to monitor Azure Redis Cache](cache-how-to-monitor.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to monitor Azure Redis Cache](cache-how-to-monitor.md).

trans-unit.source: Maxmemory-policy and maxmemory-reserved
trans-unit.target: Maxmemory-policy and maxmemory-reserved

trans-unit.source: Click **Maxmemory policy** to configure the memory policies for the cache.
trans-unit.target: Click **Maxmemory policy** to configure the memory policies for the cache.

trans-unit.source: The **maxmemory-policy** setting configures the eviction policy for the cache and **maxmemory-reserved** configures the memory reserved for non-cache processes.
trans-unit.target: The **maxmemory-policy** setting configures the eviction policy for the cache and **maxmemory-reserved** configures the memory reserved for non-cache processes.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Maxmemory Policy
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Maxmemory Policy

trans-unit.source: **Maxmemory policy** allows you to choose from the following eviction policies.
trans-unit.target: **Maxmemory policy** allows you to choose from the following eviction policies.

trans-unit.source: volatile-lru - this is the default.
trans-unit.target: volatile-lru - this is the default.

trans-unit.source: allkeys-lru
trans-unit.target: allkeys-lru

trans-unit.source: volatile-random
trans-unit.target: volatile-random

trans-unit.source: allkeys-random
trans-unit.target: allkeys-random

trans-unit.source: volatile-ttl
trans-unit.target: volatile-ttl

trans-unit.source: noeviction
trans-unit.target: noeviction

trans-unit.source: For more information about maxmemory policies, see [Eviction policies](http://redis.io/topics/lru-cache#eviction-policies).
trans-unit.target: For more information about maxmemory policies, see [Eviction policies](http://redis.io/topics/lru-cache#eviction-policies).

trans-unit.source: The **maxmemory-reserved** setting configures the amount of memory in MB that is reserved for non-cache operations such as replication during failover.
trans-unit.target: The **maxmemory-reserved** setting configures the amount of memory in MB that is reserved for non-cache operations such as replication during failover.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used when you have a high fragmentation ratio.
trans-unit.target: It can also be used when you have a high fragmentation ratio.

trans-unit.source: Setting this value allows you to have a more consistent Redis server experience when your load varies.
trans-unit.target: Setting this value allows you to have a more consistent Redis server experience when your load varies.

trans-unit.source: This value should be set higher for workloads which are write heavy.
trans-unit.target: This value should be set higher for workloads which are write heavy.

trans-unit.source: When memory is reserved for such operations it is unavailable for storage of cached data.
trans-unit.target: When memory is reserved for such operations it is unavailable for storage of cached data.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The **maxmemory-reserved** setting is only available for Standard caches.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The **maxmemory-reserved** setting is only available for Standard caches.

trans-unit.source: Keyspace notifications (advanced settings)
trans-unit.target: Keyspace notifications (advanced settings)

trans-unit.source: Click **Advanced settings** to configure Redis keyspace notifications.
trans-unit.target: Click **Advanced settings** to configure Redis keyspace notifications.

trans-unit.source: Keyspace notifications allows clients to receive notifications when certain events occur.
trans-unit.target: Keyspace notifications allows clients to receive notifications when certain events occur.

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Advanced Settings
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Advanced Settings

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Keyspace notifications and the **notify-keyspace-events** setting are only available for Standard caches.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Keyspace notifications and the **notify-keyspace-events** setting are only available for Standard caches.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Redis Keyspace Notifications](http://redis.io/topics/notifications).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Redis Keyspace Notifications](http://redis.io/topics/notifications).

trans-unit.source: For sample code, see the [KeySpaceNotifications.cs](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/blob/master/HelloWorld/KeySpaceNotifications.cs) file in the [Hello world](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/tree/master/HelloWorld) sample.
trans-unit.target: For sample code, see the [KeySpaceNotifications.cs](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/blob/master/HelloWorld/KeySpaceNotifications.cs) file in the [Hello world](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/tree/master/HelloWorld) sample.

trans-unit.source: Users and tags
trans-unit.target: Users and tags

trans-unit.source: Redis Cache Users and Tags
trans-unit.target: Redis Cache Users and Tags

trans-unit.source: The **Users** section provides support for role-based access control (RBAC) in the preview portal to help organizations meet their access management requirements simply and precisely.
trans-unit.target: The **Users** section provides support for role-based access control (RBAC) in the preview portal to help organizations meet their access management requirements simply and precisely.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Role-based access control in the Azure preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=512803).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Role-based access control in the Azure preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=512803).

trans-unit.source: The **Tags** section helps you organize your resources.
trans-unit.target: The **Tags** section helps you organize your resources.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Using tags to organize your Azure resources](../resource-group-using-tags.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using tags to organize your Azure resources](../resource-group-using-tags.md).

trans-unit.source: Default Redis server configuration
trans-unit.target: Default Redis server configuration

trans-unit.source: New Azure Redis Cache instances are configured with the following default Redis configuration values.
trans-unit.target: New Azure Redis Cache instances are configured with the following default Redis configuration values.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The settings in this section cannot be changed using the `StackExchange.Redis.IServer.ConfigSet` method.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The settings in this section cannot be changed using the `StackExchange.Redis.IServer.ConfigSet` method.

trans-unit.source: If this method is called with one of the commands in this section, an exception similar to the following is thrown:
trans-unit.target: If this method is called with one of the commands in this section, an exception similar to the following is thrown:

trans-unit.source: Any values that are configurable, such as **max-memory-policy**, are configurable through the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Any values that are configurable, such as **max-memory-policy**, are configurable through the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Default value
trans-unit.target: Default value

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: databases
trans-unit.target: databases

trans-unit.source: The default database is DB 0, you can select a different one on a per-connection basis using connection.GetDataBase(dbid) where dbid is a number between 0 and 15.
trans-unit.target: The default database is DB 0, you can select a different one on a per-connection basis using connection.GetDataBase(dbid) where dbid is a number between 0 and 15.

trans-unit.source: maxclients
trans-unit.target: maxclients

trans-unit.source: Depends on the pricing tier<sup>1</sup>
trans-unit.target: Depends on the pricing tier<sup>1</sup>

trans-unit.source: This is the maximum number of connected clients allowed at the same time.
trans-unit.target: This is the maximum number of connected clients allowed at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Once the limit is reached Redis will close all the new connections sending an error 'max number of clients reached'.
trans-unit.target: Once the limit is reached Redis will close all the new connections sending an error 'max number of clients reached'.

trans-unit.source: maxmemory-policy
trans-unit.target: maxmemory-policy

trans-unit.source: volatile-lru
trans-unit.target: volatile-lru

trans-unit.source: Maxmemory policy is the setting for how Redis will select what to remove when maxmemory (the size of the cache offering you selected when you created the cache) is reached.
trans-unit.target: Maxmemory policy is the setting for how Redis will select what to remove when maxmemory (the size of the cache offering you selected when you created the cache) is reached.

trans-unit.source: With Azure Redis Cache the default setting is volatile-lru, which removes the keys with an expire set using an LRU algorithm.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Redis Cache the default setting is volatile-lru, which removes the keys with an expire set using an LRU algorithm.

trans-unit.source: This setting can be configured in the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This setting can be configured in the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Maxmemory-policy and maxmemory-reserved](#maxmemory-policy-and-maxmemory-reserved).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Maxmemory-policy and maxmemory-reserved](#maxmemory-policy-and-maxmemory-reserved).

trans-unit.source: maxmemory-samples
trans-unit.target: maxmemory-samples

trans-unit.source: LRU and minimal TTL algorithms are not precise algorithms but approximated algorithms (in order to save memory), so you can select as well the sample size to check.
trans-unit.target: LRU and minimal TTL algorithms are not precise algorithms but approximated algorithms (in order to save memory), so you can select as well the sample size to check.

trans-unit.source: For instance for default Redis will check three keys and pick the one that was used less recently.
trans-unit.target: For instance for default Redis will check three keys and pick the one that was used less recently.

trans-unit.source: lua-time-limit
trans-unit.target: lua-time-limit

trans-unit.source: Max execution time of a Lua script in milliseconds.
trans-unit.target: Max execution time of a Lua script in milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: If the maximum execution time is reached Redis will log that a script is still in execution after the maximum allowed time and will start to reply to queries with an error.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum execution time is reached Redis will log that a script is still in execution after the maximum allowed time and will start to reply to queries with an error.

trans-unit.source: lua-event-limit
trans-unit.target: lua-event-limit

trans-unit.source: This is the max size of script event queue.
trans-unit.target: This is the max size of script event queue.

trans-unit.source: client-output-buffer-limit normalclient-output-buffer-limit pubsub
trans-unit.target: client-output-buffer-limit normalclient-output-buffer-limit pubsub

trans-unit.source: The client output buffer limits can be used to force disconnection of clients that are not reading data from the server fast enough for some reason (a common reason is that a Pub/Sub client can't consume messages as fast as the publisher can produce them).
trans-unit.target: The client output buffer limits can be used to force disconnection of clients that are not reading data from the server fast enough for some reason (a common reason is that a Pub/Sub client can't consume messages as fast as the publisher can produce them).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [http://redis.io/topics/clients](http://redis.io/topics/clients).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [http://redis.io/topics/clients](http://redis.io/topics/clients).

trans-unit.source: <sup>1</sup>`maxclients` is different for each Azure Redis Cache pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: <sup>1</sup>`maxclients` is different for each Azure Redis Cache pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: C0 (250 MB) cache - up to 256 connections
trans-unit.target: C0 (250 MB) cache - up to 256 connections

trans-unit.source: C1 (1 GB) cache - up to 1,000 connections
trans-unit.target: C1 (1 GB) cache - up to 1,000 connections

trans-unit.source: C2 (2.5 GB) cache - up to 2,000 connections
trans-unit.target: C2 (2.5 GB) cache - up to 2,000 connections

trans-unit.source: C3 (6 GB) cache - up to 5,000 connections
trans-unit.target: C3 (6 GB) cache - up to 5,000 connections

trans-unit.source: C4 (13 GB) cache - up to 10,000 connections
trans-unit.target: C4 (13 GB) cache - up to 10,000 connections

trans-unit.source: C5 (26 GB) cache - up to 15,000 connections
trans-unit.target: C5 (26 GB) cache - up to 15,000 connections

trans-unit.source: C6 (53 GB) cache - up to 20,000 connections
trans-unit.target: C6 (53 GB) cache - up to 20,000 connections

trans-unit.source: Redis commands not supported in Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Redis commands not supported in Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Because configuration and management of Azure Redis Cache instances is done using the preview portal the following commands are disabled.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Because configuration and management of Azure Redis Cache instances is done using the preview portal the following commands are disabled.

trans-unit.source: If you try to invoke them you will receive an error message similar to `"(error) ERR unknown command"`.
trans-unit.target: If you try to invoke them you will receive an error message similar to `"(error) ERR unknown command"`.

trans-unit.source: BGREWRITEAOF
trans-unit.target: BGREWRITEAOF

trans-unit.source: BGSAVE
trans-unit.target: BGSAVE

trans-unit.source: CONFIG
trans-unit.target: CONFIG

trans-unit.source: DEBUG
trans-unit.target: DEBUG

trans-unit.source: MIGRATE
trans-unit.target: MIGRATE

trans-unit.source: SAVE
trans-unit.target: SAVE

trans-unit.source: SHUTDOWN
trans-unit.target: SHUTDOWN

trans-unit.source: SLAVEOF
trans-unit.target: SLAVEOF

trans-unit.source: For more information about Redis commands, see [http://redis.io/commands](http://redis.io/commands).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Redis commands, see [http://redis.io/commands](http://redis.io/commands).

trans-unit.source: Redis console
trans-unit.target: Redis console

trans-unit.source: You can securely issue commands to your Azure Redis Cache instances using the **Redis Console**, which is available for Standard caches.
trans-unit.target: You can securely issue commands to your Azure Redis Cache instances using the **Redis Console**, which is available for Standard caches.

trans-unit.source: To access the Redis Console, click **Console** from the **Redis Cache** blade.
trans-unit.target: To access the Redis Console, click **Console** from the **Redis Cache** blade.

trans-unit.source: Redis console
trans-unit.target: Redis console

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The Redis Console is only available for Standard caches.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The Redis Console is only available for Standard caches.

trans-unit.source: To issue commands against your cache instance, simply type in the desired command into the console.
trans-unit.target: To issue commands against your cache instance, simply type in the desired command into the console.

trans-unit.source: Redis console
trans-unit.target: Redis console

trans-unit.source: For list of Redis commands that are disabled for Azure Redis Cache, see the previous [Redis commands not supported in Azure Redis Cache](#redis-commands-not-supported-in-azure-redis-cache) section.
trans-unit.target: For list of Redis commands that are disabled for Azure Redis Cache, see the previous [Redis commands not supported in Azure Redis Cache](#redis-commands-not-supported-in-azure-redis-cache) section.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Redis commands, see [http://redis.io/commands](http://redis.io/commands).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Redis commands, see [http://redis.io/commands](http://redis.io/commands).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more information on working with Redis commands, see [How can I run Redis commands?](cache-faq.md#how-can-i-run-redis-commands).
trans-unit.target: For more information on working with Redis commands, see [How can I run Redis commands?](cache-faq.md#how-can-i-run-redis-commands).
